name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  If there is fixation of hemilarynx or larynx, assign T3.

**Note 2:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined to one of the following subsites:
       Laryngopharynx
       Postcricoid area
       Posterior pharyngeal wall
       Pyriform sinus

    Tumor invades more than one subsite of hypopharynx WITHOUT fixation of hemilarynx

    Oropharynx
    Larynx WITHOUT fixation

    Localized, NOS
rows:
Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension, or with
fixation of hemilarynx or extension to esophagus

Fixation of hemilarynx or larynx

Stated as T3

Tumor invades any of the following:
Thyroid/cricoid cartilage
Hyoid bone
Thyroid gland
Esophagus
Central compartment soft tissue

Central compartment soft tissues of neck including:
    Prelaryngeal strap muscles
    Subcutaneous fat

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades prevertebral fascia, encases carotid 
artery, or invades mediastinal structures

Carotid artery (encased)

Base of tongue
Floor of mouth
Nasopharynx

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4b

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record

Tumor limited to one subsite of hypopharynx and/or 
2 cm or less in greatest dimension

Tumor invades more than one subsite of hypopharynx or
an adjacent site, OR
Measures more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest
dimension, without fixation of hemilarynx
